title: 5W-KILO
author: 5W-KILO
content: In the future how will we keep ourselves safe? When crypto becomes general something and everyone owns coins and tokens and we all become our own banks don't you think this will have a bad effect? Criminals of the future will just kidnap you and ask you, recovery seed or your life, I just think about this now, I think you should tooIt's always bank problem if anything happens to customers money, robbers don't rob homes anymore since they knew only few money can be get but banks became the main target.I feel a bit safe here because many don't know what crypto is, I can start talking about crypto from morning till night and every one will look at me like I am losing my mind. Just passing by....

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: 5W-KILO on September 29, 2022, 06:58:29 AMIn the future how will we keep ourselves safe? When crypto becomes general something and everyone owns coins and tokens and we all become our own banks don't you think this will have a bad effect? Criminals of the future will just kidnap you and ask you, recovery seed or your life, I just think about this now, I think you should too1. The first rule is to not brag about your wealth.2. Never keep all the eggs in the same basket. In the same way you can have with fiat one wallet with you everywhere and the rest is safely stored, you can have the same with crypto.3. You can keep the seed of your wealth in a safety deposit in bank or buried in your garden.4. A good bitcoin wallet offers the choice of plausible deniability. I expect people will learn to use that.5. Be your own bank is not for everybody, whether we like it or not. There will always be crypto services that will act like the banks = private businesses happy to hold the coins for you. Now they're less regulated and the money is not safe there, but this may change in the future.

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: Quote from: 5W-KILO on September 29, 2022, 06:58:29 AMIn the future how will we keep ourselves safe? Bitcoin gives you freedom of choice. If you want to be bankless, you can certainly do that. You have full control of your money, unlike with fiat currencies, where you have no choice but to trust a bank to keep your money safe. But, it's up to you to take precautions and protect yourself the best you can.The unfortunate truth is that nobody can protect you from your own stupidity. So, we are likely to see more scams, thefts, and a whole host of other problems. For now, there are a few things that you can do to protect yourself and your money. Protect your private keys, understand where your crypto is going, and take steps to keep it safe. However, as Bitcoin matures and expands over the next 10 years and beyond, I'm sure we're going to see plenty of advancements in the arena of cryptocurrency and banking.

comments.author: isaac_clarke22
comments.body: Quote from: 5W-KILO on September 29, 2022, 06:58:29 AM~Even here, you might not want to talk about all day on how much you earn from crypto or that you are indeed holding this "x" coin right now all day. You're making yourself an easy target for these criminals and no, it is not just the criminals that we're talking about here. We're talking about doxers as well. Just keep a low profile and you will be just fine. I had some friends that I had cut ties back in the days when they backstabbed me about my crypto-related stuff. I believe I mentioned it to some people in here before, but that was it.

comments.author: Despairo
comments.body: This is why everyone need to learn about privacy in the first place to avoid this kind problem happen. Make sure you hold most of your coins on hardware wallet and never link it to anywhere (e.g. exchange, unknown server, casino etc). Let's say the worst thing happen when the robbers force you to give them your private key, you can give him the smaller amount you have. They will don't have any way to find if you have another one.Another thing is don't let anyone know if you're wealthy e.g. wear branded clothes, bought luxury stuff etc.

comments.author: Rruchi man
comments.body: As we move further towards adoption, the technology will evolve and become better and we'll see safer and better security measures for people who own cryptocurrency. I say this because if you consider other financial institutions like the regular banks you have, you would agree with me that the level of sophistication security-wise that they have today, is not the same level they had some years ago. Having faced some security challenges over the years the regular banks although not yet perfect, have become more developed to address security issues. When bitcoin goes mainstream definitely some people will first be victims to theft but I believe that in the long run any security challenge that will arise will also be addressed and tackled. Your target as of right now should be not to be among those first persons that will fall victim or even fall victim at all when bitcoin goes mainstream.

comments.author: Asiska02
comments.body: Even though many people have adopted cryptocurrency, not everyone will hold it in the future. Even if 90% of the world's population owns a cryptocurrency, you can fool the rest of the world into thinking you're one of the 10% who don't. Keeping your riches hidden from the public eye will help you do this. The level of protection you'll provide your own bank reflects how cautious you are about releasing your crypto assets to the public. Robbery cannot occur in the absence of a clue, as it has in the majority of previous incidents.
